page.title: 20FRUIT FARMING
page.content: A big percentage of the apples and pears grown at Mockbeggar are stored in large cold stores for up to three months. Mockbeggar also grows a lot of soft fruit such as strawberries,rasberries, gooseberries and they have a very big 'Pick your own' part to the farm as well as their own Farm Shop.Straw is also used extensively with the strawberry crop and they use special machines for laying the straw under the plants.Polythene is also used to protect the young fruit plants from the frost. Acknowedgments THanks to the children of CLass M at Chattenden CP School for the research work. To Lt.Col Fawcus 12 RSME, Maj. Alexander PR&A, Maj.Hogben EODTIC, Mr Ballard, Miss Lash and the staff at Mockbeggar Farm and Mrs Todd.
